{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = 1-azurewave.JPG |image1_size = 150px |caption = 802.11b/g/n Wireless LAN Bluetooth Combo Half Mini Card |caption2 = Wireless LAN, Bluetooth, and FM Rx |pp = |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = AzureWave_AW-NH931 |wikipedia = |brand = AzureWave |model = AW-NH931 |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = May 23, 2011 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/AzureWave_AW-NH931 |sernum = |wlclass = N150 |series = |if = Mini PCIe |if_bus_version = 2.0 |ifconnector = SDIO |formfactor = (half) |vendor_id = |device_id = |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = TLZ-NH931 |icid = 6100A-NH931 |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 74:2F:68 |chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4329; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = U.FL |antenna = |txchains = 1 |rxchains = 1 |sstreams = 1 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 150 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = Bluetooth |802dot11_protocols = bgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 02/17/2011 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== While this card is ''physically'' compatible with PCI-Express mini, it isn't ''electrically'' compatible. It goes undetected by standard x86 hardware (like the [[Soekris Engineering net6501|Soekris net6501]] or [[PC Engines APU]]) :because WiFi chip uses an SPI (SDIO) interface, Bluetooth uses UART, and FM uses I2C. The IC used is unlabeled, but the device's specifications indicate it's ''[[Broadcom]]'' based. :Googlery [http://web.archive.org/web/20140627225558/http://www.makromikro.hr/Files/Resources/ZG_MAKROMIKRO/izjave/toshiba/Potvrda%20o%20sukladnosti%20-%20prijenosna%20ra%C4%8Dunala%20Toshiba%20AT100%20serije.pdf indicates it's using BCM4329]. ''[[AzureWave]]'' sells a variety of modules which embed [https://wikidevi.com/w/index.php?title=Special%3AAsk&q=%5B%5BWI1+module%3A%3A~AzureWave*%5D%5D+%5B%5BWI1+module+IF%3A%3A%21~*USB*%5D%5D+%5B%5BWI1+module+IF%3A%3A%21~PCI*%5D%5D&po=%3FWI1+module%0D%0A%3FWI1+chip1+model%0D%0A&eq=yes&p%5Bformat%5D=broadtable&sort_num=&order_num=ASC&p%5Blimit%5D=&p%5Boffset%5D=&p%5Blink%5D=all&p%5Bsort%5D=&p%5Bheaders%5D=show&p%5Bmainlabel%5D=&p%5Bintro%5D=&p%5Boutro%5D=&p%5Bsearchlabel%5D=%E2%80%A6+further+results&p%5Bdefault%5D=&p%5Bclass%5D=sortable+wikitable+smwtable&eq=yes ''Broadcom'' and ''Marvell'' silicon], such as [http://www.azurewave.com/product_AW-NH611_1.asp AW-NH611].
However, like most (if not all) of ''[[AzureWave]]'''s modules, [http://m.pchome.net/article/1387367_p10_all.html AW-NH611] seems to use a PBGA package. ===Devices likely using this module=== *'''Toshiba''' Thrive tablet *[[wikipedia:ThinkPad Tablet|'''Lenovo''' Thinkpad Tablet]] (FRU # 60Y3285) ==Pictures==
'''User Images''' File:1-azurewave.JPG|card back File:2-azurewave.JPG|card labels File:3-azurewave.JPG|card PCB
